title: Famous Myths
description: Test your knowledge of classic Greek stories!

questions.question: What was inside Pandora's Box?

options.text: All the evils of the world

questions.explanation: Pandora's Box (actually a jar) contained all evils. When opened, only Hope remained inside.

questions.question: What caused the Trojan War?
questions.explanation: The Trojan War began when Paris of Troy took Helen, wife of King Menelaus of Sparta.

questions.question: Orpheus traveled to the underworld to rescue his wife Eurydice.
questions.explanation: Orpheus's music convinced Hades to let Eurydice go, but he looked back and lost her forever.

questions.question: Why was Prometheus punished by Zeus?
questions.explanation: Prometheus stole fire from the gods and gave it to humanity. Zeus chained him to a rock where an eagle ate his liver daily.

questions.question: What was the Greeks' trick to win the Trojan War?
questions.explanation: The Greeks hid soldiers inside a giant wooden horse, which the Trojans brought inside their walls.

questions.question: Why must Persephone spend part of each year in the underworld?
questions.explanation: Persephone ate pomegranate seeds in the underworld, binding her to return there for part of each year, creating winter.

questions.question: King Midas wished that everything he touched would turn to gold.
questions.explanation: Midas's wish became a curse when even his food and daughter turned to gold at his touch.

questions.question: What did Narcissus fall in love with?
questions.explanation: Narcissus fell in love with his own reflection in a pool and wasted away staring at it.
